column2: 'I know kung fu.' is still the coolest line in any movie. Ever.
The twist that the world is a simulation and they're all batteries for the machines... that broke my brain in 1999.
The lobby shootout is a masterpiece of action choreography. It never gets old.
Neo coming back to life after being killed by Agent Smith and then seeing the code... he really is The One.
The red pill or blue pill choice is such an iconic and philosophical moment.
Cypher's betrayal, just for a taste of a fake steak, is so pathetic and chilling. 'Ignorance is bliss.'
The 'bullet time' effect was revolutionary. It completely changed action movies.
The final scene of Neo flying off into the sky is the ultimate power move. What a perfect ending.
The world-building in this movie is just incredible. The whole concept is genius.
The spoon is not real. The way the movie teaches you that your mind is the only limit... so deep.
The fashion in this movie is legendary. All black leather and tiny sunglasses.
Neo stopping the bullets at the end is the moment he finally believes in himself.
Morpheus is such a great mentor. Laurence Fishburne's performance is iconic.
The moment when Neo wakes up in the real world is pure nightmare fuel. So horrifying.
The movie is a perfect blend of sci-fi, action, and philosophy.
The defeat of Agent Smith from the inside out is such a cool and unique way to win a fight.
The training montage in the construct is so cool.
The Oracle being just a regular old lady baking cookies was a great subversion of expectations.
This movie is a cultural phenomenon for a reason. It's a masterpiece.
The final phone call to the machines is the most badass ending to a movie ever.
The concept of 'residual self-image' is such a cool detail.
The way Neo dodges the bullets on the rooftop is one of the most iconic shots in cinema history.
Agent Smith is one of the greatest villains of all time. Hugo Weaving is terrifying.
The ending, where Neo becomes a superhero inside the simulation, is so triumphant.
The philosophical questions this movie raises about reality and choice are still relevant today.
The reveal of what the Matrix actually is, is one of the best plot twists ever.
The wire-fu action sequences were groundbreaking.
The moment Trinity brings Neo back with a kiss... a bit cheesy but it totally works.
The movie is just so incredibly cool. The aesthetic is unmatched.
The final fight between Neo and Smith is a classic showdown.
The idea that humans are a virus is a dark but interesting take from Agent Smith.
The way Neo sees the Matrix as green code at the end is a perfect visual representation of his power.
The dialogue is so quotable. 'Woah.'
The betrayal by Cypher, killing off the crew one by one, was so tense.
The film is a perfect hero's journey.
The ending is a promise of a revolution. So epic.
The 'woman in the red dress' scene is a great lesson about distractions.
The way Neo sacrifices himself to save Morpheus shows he's a true leader.
A perfect movie that changed the game for sci-fi and action films.
The final scene is a perfect mic drop.
The Sentinels in the real world are terrifying.
The moment he stops the bullets is the ultimate power fantasy fulfillment.
The movie is a mind-bending trip from start to finish.
The way Trinity saves him at the end with 'true love's kiss' is a great emotional beat.
The world of the Nebuchadnezzar feels so real and lived-in.
The final fight is not just physical, but a battle of belief.
The film is a timeless classic that gets better with every watch.
The ending shows that he is no longer bound by the rules of the system.
The action scenes are like a beautiful, violent ballet.
The way they 'jack in' to the Matrix is such a cool concept.
The movie is a perfect metaphor for waking up to the truth.
The final shot of him flying is the ultimate symbol of freedom.
The cast has incredible chemistry.
The Oracle's prophecy and the theme of choice are central to Neo's journey.
The film is a visual and intellectual masterpiece.
The moment he becomes The One is one of the most triumphant in movie history.
The helicopter rescue scene is an amazing action set piece.
The way the Agents can take over any person in the Matrix is a terrifying idea.
A groundbreaking film that redefined a genre.
The ending is a powerful statement about breaking free from control.
The production design is so iconic.
The way Neo has to unlearn what he knows to succeed is a great message.
The movie is just a perfect piece of filmmaking.
The final scene is a perfect setup for the sequels.
The fight in the subway station is a classic.
The moment he sees the code is when he truly understands the nature of his reality.
The film is a cultural touchstone.
The way he re-enters the Matrix to save his friends is a true hero's choice.
The visual effects were years ahead of their time.
The ending is a declaration of war against the machines. So cool.
The philosophy is just as important as the action.
The way he takes the bullet for Trinity and then gets back up is a huge moment.
The movie is a perfect storm of style, substance, and spectacle.
The final shot is a promise of liberation for all of humanity.
The 'deja vu' cat scene is a clever way to explain glitches in the Matrix.
The moment he realizes his power is not in his body, but in his mind, is the key.
A true masterpiece of science fiction.
The ending is the perfect culmination of his journey from a nobody to a savior.
The world of Zion and the hovercrafts is so well-realized.
The way he has to die to be reborn as The One is a classic mythological trope.
The film is a timeless classic that will be studied for decades.
The final scene is a powerful symbol of human potential.
The action is just poetry in motion.
The reveal of the human farms is a horrifying and unforgettable image.
The movie is a perfect hero's origin story.
The ending, where he fully embraces his power, is so satisfying.
The iconic green code is a visual shorthand for the entire franchise.
The way he has to choose between his old life and the truth is a powerful dilemma.
The film is a landmark achievement in cinema.
The final phone call is a direct challenge to the system, and it's awesome.
The 'bullet time' effect will forever be associated with this movie.
The moment he stands his ground against Smith instead of running is a huge character shift.
A perfect movie. No notes.
The ending is a perfect, empowering conclusion that sets up a larger war.
The world-building is so dense and fascinating.
The way he defeats Smith by becoming one with the code is a brilliant concept.
The movie is a cultural reset.
The final shot is a promise of freedom and a new world.
